title: Sneaker Maker Allbirds Files for IPO
sub_head: Sustainable shoe brand plans to list on the Nasdaq
body:
Sneaker maker Allbirds Inc. has filed for an initial public offering.
The San Francisco-based startup, known for its eco-friendly sneakers, has seen its shoes grow in popularity among people working in the tech industry.
The company had 27 stores as of June 30, including in New York City, Shanghai and Berlin, it said Tuesday. In 2020, the companyâ€™s digital channel represented 89% of sales, according to a securities filing.
The company said it has applied to list its shares on Nasdaq under the ticker symbol BIRD.
Allbirds said it plans to use net proceeds from the offering to fund its working capital, operating expenses, capital expenditures and other purposes. The company said it could also use part of the proceeds to acquire or invest in complementary businesses, products, services or technologies.
